QAPair.Question: What is (are) Epilepsy - what to ask your doctor - child ?
QAPair.Answer: Your child has epilepsy . Children with epilepsy have recurrent seizures. A seizure is a sudden brief change in the electrical activity in the brain. Your child may have brief periods of unconsciousness and uncontrollable body movements during seizures. Children with epilepsy can have one or more types of seizures. Below are some questions you may want to ask your child's health care provider to help you take care of your child's epilepsy.
